ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, I would recommend the course to anyone who wants to improve their classical Chinese or gain a greater understanding of premodern China.
My fellow students enjoyed the class and took away new ideas to analyze other classical texts. I will strongly recommend this course to any student who is interested in late Imperial China.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Yes; this is an excellent coursein some of the fundamental texts of classical prose and definitely teaches both linguistic skills and philosophical background to almost any dissertation topic from the Song to the Ming dynasty.

I am working on maps produced around 1500 to 1950. Returning to the historical documents after taking this course, I am much more comfortable with classical Chinese text and more confidently interpret and punctuate the text.
